name: Ed Markey
tweet_text: Billionaire tech CEOs’ promises to enhance privacy, improve algorithms, and protect kids are useless. The only way to imbue our values into today’s technologies is to end the era of failed self-regulation and enact laws. 4/5

name: Ed Markey

name: Ed Markey

If you're just tuning in, algorithmic justice is not new. It's an issue I've worked on for years to address the systemic biases which harm marginalized communities and are disastrous when taken online and baked into Big Tech’s algorithms.

name: Ed Markey

name: Ed Markey
tweet_text: President Biden has wisely started implementing sanctions—our best non-military option—to impose consequences on the Kremlin, Russia’s defense sector, and Putin’s petro-oligarch cronies for this blatant violation of international law.

name: Ed Markey
tweet_text: What I owe to Ray Jordan cannot be measured, and what he has given me, his colleagues, and all of Massachusetts will never be forgotten.

name: Ed Markey
tweet_text: Ray’s friendship, loyalty, and insights have been irreplaceable constants throughout my career. We used to play basketball together on Beacon Hill, and he had an indomitable presence on and off the court.

name: Ed Markey
tweet_text: Ray’s strength of conviction and keen intelligence made him a mentor to countless elected leaders in the Pioneer Valley and beyond, with his living room serving as the launching pad for Western Massachusetts politics.

name: Ed Markey
tweet_text: Ray represented the next generation of Massachusetts politicians whose commitment to progress and reform resonates to this day. He spent his career making housing more affordable, jobs more equitable, and Western Massachusetts more livable.

name: Ed Markey
tweet_text: Ray Jordan was one of the central figures in the transformation of the MA State House and he made sure equal opportunity and justice were central to state policymaking. My condolences go out to his family and all of those who called him friend and neighbor.https://t.co/txgtaUp5Ds

tweet_text: My deepest condolences go out to the Owens family, his friends, his loved ones, and all of those whose lives have forever been impacted by his pioneering presence and achievements. Bill Owens will be forever missed.

name: Ed Markey
tweet_text: For 50 years, Bill Owens was my friend and inspiration. His presence grounded me in the realities of today’s struggles, and his spirit lifted my gaze and countless others to the opportunities and justice that remained to be created for future generations.

name: Ed Markey
tweet_text: He worked to create the State Office of Minority Business Assistance and the Summer Youth Jobs Program and for passage of the Assault Weapons Ban. The legacy of that important work continues to this day.

name: Ed Markey

name: Ed Markey

name: Ed Markey
tweet_text: Throughout the pandemic, viewers across the country have relied on community media to stay safe, healthy, and informed. The Protecting Community Television Act will ensure that community TV operations continue to receive the resources they need to educate and inform viewers.

name: Ed Markey
tweet_text: As a result, local governments have to decide between supporting PEG stations in cable franchise agreements and supporting other important services for critical community institutions like schools and libraries.

name: Ed Markey
tweet_text: However, in August, 2019, the FCC voted to permit cable companies to assign a value to these contributions and then subtract that amount from the franchise fees the cable operator pays the local community.

name: Ed Markey
tweet_text: Currently, local governments are permitted to require that cable companies meet demonstrated community needs by providing in-kind contributions that benefit schools, public safety buildings, and public, educational, and government (PEG) channels, known as community TV stations.

name: Ed Markey
tweet_text:
In this era of media consolidation and globalization, it is critical that we preserve community media that lifts up local voices. I'm proud to reintroduce the Protecting Community Television Act with @SenatorBaldwin, @RepAnnaEshoo, and @RepPeterDeFazio.
https://t.co/d19sjoP4PH

name: Ed Markey
tweet_text: Trump's erratic and vindictive behavior is a scary reminder that the U.S. president does not need the backing of ANYONE, sycophant or not, to authorize the use of a U.S. nuclear weapon. We need a nuclear no-first use policy for our country.

name: Ed Markey
